story:
UN REVE D'ENFANT

« J’ai toujours rêvé de fabriquer de beaux objets. Des objets au design affirmé, que l’on aime et que l’on garde. Des objets qui ont une histoire et qui expriment des valeurs.
Il y a 2 ans, j’ai décidé de transformer ce rêve en réalité : c’est ainsi que l’aventure AKT a commencé »

François Ghys, fondateur de AKT Jewels.



DES BIJOUX ENGAGÉS

AKT est plus qu’une marque de bijoux : c’est un état d’esprit, une philosophie. Notre volonté est de transformer des outils de destruction en armes de séduction, des symboles de violence en symboles de beauté. Nous récupérons les armes auprès d’ONG chargées de désarmer des zones de conflit. Ces armes sont découpées, transportées, détruites et fondues jusqu’à disparaître complètement. Nous les faisons ensuite renaître sous forme de bijoux. Une partie de la vente des bijoux est reversée à des ONG de terrain luttant contre la violence:

« Je suis très attaché à la symbolique de l’arme transformée en bijoux. Mais je tiens à ce que nous allions au-delà du symbole. Une partie de notre chiffre d’affaires servira donc à soutenir des ONG de terrain, qui à travers le monde agissent contre la violence. »

François Ghys, fondateur de AKT Jewels.


LE DESIGN DES BIJOUX

La première collection a été imaginée par la créatrice de bijoux Delphine Nardin. Comme elle, les bijoux AKT ont une personnalité forte. Mélanges de métal et de cordelières, ils associent puissance et souplesse, caractère et sensualité, élégance et audace. Leur design enveloppant évoque la protection, la carapace.

«Ce qui m’a séduite dans le projet c’était le défi de métamorphoser un métal d’origine un peu «obscure» et qui était assez peu valorisé dans le monde du bijou, et de lui donner sa noblesse et son caractère.

Je voulais que cette collection autour de l’acier s’incarne dans une expression un peu animale, un esprit très matiéré... un peu comme une carapace, avec des éléments montés sur cordelière. Par ailleurs c’est une collection qui s’adresse à la fois aux hommes et aux femmes.»

Delphine Nardin, créatrice de la collection.


LA FABRICATION

Les bijoux AKT sont fabriqués de manière artisanale, en France (Ardèche), afin d’obtenir des formes très créatives et une excellente qualité de produit.

Le métal d'armes est fondu en laboratoire. Le traitement qu'il subit le rend inoxydable et supprime les risques d'allergie. Cette préparation permet d'obtenir un métal respectant rigoureusement les normes européennes de l'industrie du bijou.


OU LES TROUVER ?

Les bijoux AKT seront commercialisés dès 2014 dans des concepts stores, des bijouteries et des grands magasins ayant une offre créateurs. Ils seront proposés également sur internet.

Géographiquement, nous souhaitons commercialiser en Europe, en Amérique du Nord et au Japon.

A QUOI SERVIRA LA COLLECTE ?

La collecte servira à financer le développement et la fabrication de la première collection de bijoux AKT :

  • Conception des 20 premières pièces de la collection,
  • réalisation des maquettes,
  • transport du métal,
  • transformation du métal en laboratoire,
  • fabrication d'exemplaires de pré-séries pour l'action commerciale auprès des distributeurs.
Pour financer l'ensemble de ces étapes, nous avons besoin de 20 000 euros minimum. C'est une somme ! Grâce à la plateforme Indiegogo nous avons espoir de donner une réelle impulsion à notre projet.

Et si par chance nous parvenons à recueillir davantage, nous pourrons aussi :
  • créer du site marchand de la marque,
  • concevoir et fabriquer le packaging,
  • élaborer une campagne et des outils de communication,
  • participer aux salons

LES PIECES A COMMANDER MAINTENANT POUR NOUS SOUTENIR

Nous souhaitons vous faire partager cette aventure riche de sens, pour ce faire nous vous proposons d’acquérir en avant-première une série d’objets vous permettant de découvrir l’univers AKT.

Les pièces commandées lors de la collecte seront envoyées à leurs heureux propriétaires en Février.

D’avance merci pour votre soutien, nous avons hâte de pouvoir honorer nos premières commandes !





D'AUTRES FAÇONS DE NOUS AIDER

Certaines personnes ne peuvent pas contribuer, mais cela ne veut pas dire qu'elles ne peuvent pas nous aider !

Si vous aimez notre projet, parlez-en à vos amis, faites passer ce lien... Aidez-nous à faire grandir la petite Communauté AKT ! Une fois encore, merci pour votre soutien.




A CHILD'S DREAM

“I have always dreamed of making beautiful things. Objects of striking design, that we love and keep. Objects which have a story and which express certain values. Two years ago, I decided to make this dream a reality: and so the AKT adventure began.”

François Ghys, founder of AKT jewels


COMMITED JEWELRY

AKT is more than just a jewellery brand: it is a state of mind, a philosophy. Our desire is to transform tools of destruction into weapons of seduction, symbols of violence into symbols of beauty. We collect the weapons through the NGO’s in charge of disarming war zones. These weapons are dismantled, transported, destroyed and then melted down until they disappear completely. We then recreate them as jewellery. Part of the  sales is donated to the field NGO’s fighting against violence.


“I am very attached to the symbolism of a weapon transformed into jewellery. But I want it to be more than just a symbol. Part of our turnover will be used to support field NGO’s who are acting against violence all over the world.”

François Ghys, founder of AKT jewels


JEWELRY DESIGN

This first collection has been conceived by jewellery designer Delphine Nardin. Much like her, AKT jewellery has a strong personality. A mix of metal and drawstrings, the pieces combine power with versatility, character with sensuality, elegance with daring. Their wrap around design evokes ideas of protection, of armour.


“What drew me into the project was the challenge of transforming metal with a dark history, which holds very little value within the jewellery world, and giving it its own dignity and character.
I wanted this collection based around steel to manifest itself into a raw work and expression, a very material based state…almost like armour, with the elements assembled on a drawstring. In addition, it is a collection aimed at both men and women.”

Delphine Nardin, designer for the collection


MANUFACTURE

AKT jewellery is created using artisanal methods, in France (Ardèche), in order to produce highly creative items of excellent quality.
The metal from the weapons is melted down in a lab. It undergoes a treatment which renders it stainless and eliminates any risk of allergy. This preparation allows us to obtain a metal which strictly adheres to the European standards of the jewellery industry.


WHERE CAN I FIND THEM ?

AKT jewellery will be on sale as of 2014 in concept stores, jewellery stores and certain department stores who promote designers. They will also be available online.
In terms of placement, we hope to be active in Europe, North America and Japan.


WHAT IS THE FUND-RAISING FOR ?

The aim of the fund-raising is to finance the development and manufacture of the first AKT collection:

  • Designing the first 20 pieces of the collection
  • Creation of the prototypes
  • Transporting the metal
  • Treating the metal in our lab
  • Production of samples for sales pitches to distributors

In order to finance all these stages, we will need at least €20,000. Quite a significant amount of money! Thanks to the crowdfunding site Indiegogo, we hope to be able to give a project a real boost.
And if by chance we manage collect more, we also hope to:

  • Create a dedicated webshop
  • Design and manufacture the packaging
  • Develop a campaign and communication tools
  • Attend and take part in exhibitions

PIECES YOU CAN ORDER NOW TO SUPPORT US

We hope to share this meaningful adventure with you, and so we are offering you the opportunity to get your hands on an exclusive set of objects allowing you to discover the AKT universe.
Ordered pieces will be sent to their lucky owners in February.
Many thanks in advance for your support, we look forward to fulfilling our first orders!







OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Not everyone can make a financial contribution, but that doesn’t mean to say that they can’t help us!
If you like what we’re doing, talk about it to your friends, forward this link to them… Help us to expand the, currently small, AKT community! Once again, thank you for your support.

story:
With thanks to Small Black for the use of 'Moon Killer' in our video http://www.small-black.com.

Takuro is a social enterprise fashion label that takes its name from the Nepalese word meaning ‘highest point’ or ‘summit of the mountain’. Our products will help to provide sustainable employment and shelter to marginalised women in Nepal.

What else does Takuro stand for?

  • High grade raw materials. 
    • Our rucksack and shawl are made from high quality fabrics because the right material choice is at the heart of every successful design.
  • Rugged.
    •  We intend to make ‘planned obsolescence‘ a thing of the past. We have designed our products to last as long as you do.
  • We have the skills. 
    • Every member of our team is a design professional who proficiently oversees every stage of design, production & distribution.
  • Sustainability.
    •  For too long, large corporate fashion brands have exploited cheap labour to manufacture and sell products at unsustainable prices. They neglect the safety & fair wages of their workers. It is now time for a new generation of ethical fashion to take its place.
  • Support. 
    • We consider ourselves an international family. We want to support everyone in our team because that’s what families do. Our products will help to provide sustainable employment for outcast widows in Nepal. Become a part of our family.

The Manaslu is our roll-top rucksack. Constructed from high grade 600g / 21oz waxed canvas, it takes its name from the 8th highest mountain in the world. Situated in the Mansiri Himal range of the Himalayas, it is surrounded by beautiful lush forests and means "Mountain of the Spirit". 

Features that make our rucksack the best:

  • Roll-Top Design is simple yet effective. The roll-top closure system makes the bag weatherproof, adaptable to your carry load (up to 20L) and is stronger than traditional zippered tops.
  • 600g / 21oz Waxed Canvas is extremely hard-wearing and waterproof. The fabric will last and develop more character with use.
  • Custom Stainless Steel Hardware designed and manufactured in the home of steel: Sheffield, England.
  • Double Stitched to ensure the bag lasts as long as you do.
  • Hardwearing Nylon Webbing straps to complement the long lasting waxed cotton.
  • Design For Modern Life is important. That’s why we made sure that a 15” MacBook Pro fits perfectly inside. We’ve also padded the base and back to provide extra protection & comfort.

Our Manaslu rucksack is available in 3 premium colours: Green, Gold and Black. Or for a limited time only you can design your own colour scheme: choose from the 3 colours to customise each panel on the bag. Get creative!

N.B. Delivery.

If you are thinking of buying a rucksack as a Christmas gift, please, PLEASE, PLEASE don't be put off by the delivery date. You will receive a personalised Takuro Christmas Gift Card to give on the day with details about the amazing gift you are giving and the even more amazing story behind Takuro.

Our Cashmere Shawl is made from 100% Nepali cashmere. It’s probably the softest and most luxurious material you will ever find. Available in 5 colours: Black, Cream, Coral, Grey or Olive. If you are buying this as a gift, we'll try our best to deliver it to you by Christmas.

We believe that for too long, large corporate fashion houses and brands have exploited cheap labour in order to manufacture products at unsustainable prices. This trend has to stop and a new age of ethical fashion has to take its place.

Our ethos at Takuro is to work with outcast widows in Nepal, who have suffered generations of discrimination. With the help of the charity WHR-SWG (Women for Human Rights - Single Woman's Group) who train these women to sew, we will employ widows from Nepal, giving them the means to be independent.

We won't just stop there, however. Our profits will go back into providing shelter for these women and their children, as well as better facilities to manufacture the very best quality products. We want to support everyone in our team because that's what families do and that's what we want to achieve. Our goal is to build a large international family that keeps quality and equality at the core of its belief.


The Plight of Nepal's Widows 

In Nepalese culture, widows are discriminated against, often being branded witches or whores. Their society believes it is their immoral actions in a previous life that form the defining reasons  behind the deaths of their husbands. They have, therefore, been ostracized for generations, losing their status in both the home and society. Forsaken even by their own families, they struggle to find enough work to feed their children and put a roof over their heads.

Below is an introduction to the Takuro documentary, telling the story of these outcast women.

 There isn’t much fine print, just a few details.

Standard shipping applies to the UK, Europe, USA, Australia & Canada. For other destinations we reserve the right to charge a little more for postage.

If you have any problems with the rucksack or shawl, just send it back to us and we’ll repair or replace it free of charge. The return postage cost will be free of charge providing it is to an address within the standard destinations.

Because you are viewing the colours on a computer screen, the actual shade of the product may vary slightly.

story:
Our Back Story

In 2005, Canadian blogger Kyle MacDonald set out on a mission to get himself a new house starting with just a red paper clip. He began by trading that paper clip for a pen, and then the pen for a door knob, and the door knob for a camping stove, until eventually he traded a role in a movie for a house. Taking him nearly a year to complete, it’s a story that would make the entrepreneur in all of us a little jealous.

Now imagine if we could put that idea to work for social change in Tampa Bay. A group of graduate students in the entrepreneurship program at USF have ventured out to do just that. What started out as a class project to start a business with merely a paper clip as our only startup capital has snowballed into a movement to change the way we think about charity and raise money for local organizations in the process. The One Paper Clip Fund aims to raise one cent for every resident in Tampa Bay.


Helping Those Who Need It Most


1 in 4 children in the state of Florida are living in poverty. In the Tampa Bay area alone there is somewhere around 200,000 children who don’t know where their next meal will come from, and about 5,000 are living in foster care as victims of neglect or abuse. These kids find themselves in these situations and they have no control over it. What happens when they get sick? How can we help them see a better future?


Thankfully there are amazing local charities doing important work to alleviate problems associated with child hunger, homelessness, abuse, and illness. We have teamed up with a group of local children's charities who have a history of providing unique and powerful programs and services to our area's at risk youth. Our partner organizations are:

  • A Kid's Place of Tampa Bay
  • Feeding America Tampa Bay
  • Big Brothers Big Sisters Tampa Bay
  • Ronald McDonald House Charities of Tampa Bay
  • Champions for Children

    Your Change Can Make Change

    With the help of Tampa Bay's 4 million residents, we are confident that we can make a big impact and show everybody how easy it is to make a difference in our community. Please consider making your contribution today and sharing our cause with anyone you know.

With the help of Tampa Bay's 4 million residents, we are confident that we can make a big impact and show everybody how easy it is to make a difference in our community. Please consider making your contribution today and sharing our cause with anyone you know.

story:
We here at FouLanguage Clothing had an idea, to make T-shirts.

"But so do many thousands of other companies?!" I hear you cry.

Well we found ourselves seeing things or hearing things around the place and shouting "That needs to be on a T-shirt, like right NOW!!" But alas, it was never on a T-shirt, and our dreams of wearing such witty remarks combined with fantastic designs, brilliant artwork and a quality thread quickly washed away. BUT, the story doesn't end there, we came up with the idea of making those shirts we wanted to see, ourselves. And we wanted you guys to be a part of that, to have a piece of the pie, and be able to shout from the rooftops, "I MADE THAT HAPPEN", Obviously whilst wearing your amazing brand spanking new 'fuck you' to society. So whaddya' say?

We're asking for a modest £1000 to print the first run of 4 designs, with lots of lovely little perks for your kind donations of money from your hard earnings. Every and any amount is appreciated beyond doubt, and we wouldnt be able to do this without you.

Thankyou for your insane kindness,

Cas & Melissa

The FouLanguage Clothing Company

story:
Hello, my name is Mahabubur Rahaman Arman and I am the co-founder & CEO of T-ZONE. T-ZONE (www.tzonebd.com) manufactures and sells t-shirt directly to consumers through our e-commerce and f-commerce store fronts. We also happen to be Bangladesh’s first on-demand custom design t-shirt printing solution serving both domestic and international clients at a price and quality that cannot be beaten as we believe.



We started our business in June 2012 with USD $200.00 savings. Since then we have been able to manage and grow the business where we have been able to break-even. We have not only established ourselves as a good local brand but also earned the reputation for selling export quality t-shirt at an affordable price with no additional shipping charges. In addition to selling t-shirts directly to consumers, we have done on-demand custom t-shirt manufacturing plus branding for:


Today, we are at a crossroad where we feel it necessary to expand our footprint and make our t-shirts and our services available to the global market.

We have participated in local events such as Digital World Expo 2012 (www.digitalworld.org.bd), e-Commerce Fair 2013 (www.e-commercefair.com) in Dhaka Bangladesh. We have also pitched our business idea in competitions such as pitch2win that was held by shetu.org as well as in National Entrepreneur Summit 2013 (riseforgdp.com) in Dhaka, Bangladesh. In fact, the founder of Shetu.org loved our product so much that they became our corporate client since then.

Recently, we have been featured in various local newspapers (both english & bengali) as well as Blogs such as Techshohor.com , Projuktikothon.com and etc, highlighting our journey, success despite our struggles and odds against us. Furthermore, we have been on the "Young Night" ATN Bangla (a Bangladeshi TV channel) program. The "Young Night" program features & highlight youth entrepreneurs who continues their journey despite the strong headwinds. You can find the TV show here: 

Part-1  Part-2 Part-3


We are doing something really special - Our strategy with this campaign is to get these shirts to as many people as possible. So, at the expense of making profits, we are offering rewards that will amaze you for what you'll be getting. Check them out:


Bangladesh is well known for its Ready Made Garments (RMG) industries and is ranked amongst the top 3 producing countries. We generally produce garments for third parties under their label. When you visit any stores in the western world, you will surely see a lot of “Made in Bangladesh” t-shirts and other garments products. However, you will not see any Bangladeshi label in the stores nor will you be able to purchase any Bangladeshi labels directly from Bangladesh through e-commerce or f-commerce.

We feel it is high time, we should enter the international market and be the first t-shirt company selling directly to international customers via online at an affordable price. Our best quality t-shirt (weighing between 180-200gsm) can be supplied to a customer in the USA for USD $9 / pcs (shipping excluded). FedEx and EMS is our shipping partner thereby allowing us to ship products economically as well as reliably and reach you within a few days.

We can provide such a deep discount because we manufacture and print our own t-shirt. Plus since we do not have any store fronts and ship directly from our factory, our overhead cost is less. Think how Amazon.com saved everyone money because they are not a brick and mortar operation.

And if you do not like any of our designs, for a small upcharge you can print your own design and have it shipped to your door regardless of where in the world you are located. 


We will try to do the same in small range though it will be hard to do but Impossible is nothing.

Help us reach our goal by sharing this awesome project with your family and friends through social media. Tell them that soon they will be able to purchase t-shirts directly from a Bangladeshi manufacturer at a very affordable price without compromising on quality. 

And don't forget to share with Indiegogo sharing tools!

story:
Finding a pair of dress shoes that are COMFORTABLE and in the STYLE we want isn't always easy. Tired of aching feet and spending countless hours trying on shoes, we set off on a journey to find a solution.

  • The PROBLEM is STANDARD SIZING. Shoes today use a "one size fits all" approach by using a single 2-dimensional measurement, the foot length, to approximate the fit of a shoe. The problem with this method is that it IGNORES the varying shapes, girths, and other 3-dimensional attributes of a person's foot. 
  • BESPOKE is the answer but is expensive, hard to find, require multiple appointments, and can take up to 6-8 months. 
  • The SOLUTION is MADE. We're bringing bespoke to the digital age by offering a smartphone 3D foot scanner app, taking orders online, and delivering our shoes to your doorstep. 

Gone are the days of COMPROMISING between quality, style, and fit.  

  • QUALITY CONSTRUCTION - Each pair is HANDMADE and takes over 200 steps & 20+ man hours. 
  • BUILT TO LAST - most shoes are glued together. Ours are hand stitched allowing them to be resoled
  • PREMIUM CALFSKIN - We only source leathers derived from top quality European rawhides
  • CUSTOM FIT - Standard sizing ignores individual anatomy. We take a combination of 14 measurements to develop a fit that follows the natural shape of your feet.
  • VERTICALLY INTEGRATED - We own our factory.  This allows us to offer high quality shoes at a fraction of the cost of traditional bespoke. 

SCAN REQUIREMENTS

  • MADE Scan Kit
  • MADE Scan App (iOS)
  • A helping hand

Backers will receive a Scan Kit containing a pair of specially designed socks which must be worn during the scanning process.  The MADE Scan App will guide you through your first scan with step-by-step instructions and an easy to follow video.  Scan your feet in the comfort of your own home in under 5 minutes.  No shoemaker necessary.  

The MADE experience takes personalization to a new level. We offer a variety of customization options allowing you to create a one of a kind pair that's unique to you.

  • 4 upper colors (black, [patina:] oxblood, dark brown, brown)
  • 3 lining colors (black, brown, tan)
  • 2 outsole colors (black, red)
  • 2 outsole options (half-rubber/half leather, full leather)
  • 2 Toe shapes (smart round, soft square)
  • Monogram option on outsole: up to 3 letters

Two weeks after submitting your scan, you’ll receive a pair of prototype shoes to check the fit. In the situation where a major revision is required, another pair of prototype shoes will be made.  From our experience, one fitting is usually enough.  

After a good fit is confirmed, you'll receive your final shoes in 4-6 weeks. Because we have your fit on file, subsequent orders will skip the fitting stage and go straight to production.

HAND WELTED CONSTRUCTION
Synonymous with quality and tradition, this technique has remained the same for over 100 years and is used by only a handful of high-end brands.

DIRECT TO CONSUMER
By bringing production in house and taking orders online, we cut out the middle men and relay the savings to you. 

OUR STORY
After working with over 20 manufacturers in 4 countries, we realized that nobody was willing to adopt the level of customization and quality that we wanted.  In order to get it right, we needed to do ourselves. 

We invested in our own facility and assembled a team of master craftsmen in Guangzhou, China, the largest footwear producing city in the world.

We're a small team with big goals.  Although we've made tons of progress, setting up our manufacturing facility was only the first piece of the puzzle.  We've bootstrapped our vision of revolutionizing the bespoke shoe industry to this point, but now we need your help to piece the rest together.

story:
The store mannequins all have shirts on that look trim and fit.

But when you look in the back, you realize every shirt is pinned due to the excess fabric made to accommodate the rounder American consumer. 

Traditional tailoring methods are expensive and time consuming. Going to a tailor can cost anywhere from $10-20 a shirt. Custom fitted shirts? These cost an arm and a leg and I enjoy having those.  

Having a ton of student loans, I knew there had to be a better way to get the proper fit. 

You can tailor your shirt by following these simple steps!

Unlike traditional tailoring methods, the ZipSeam is adjustable and reusable. 

Here are the prototypes we went through to perfect the ZipSeam 2.0

Initial prototype made in my parents' basement-

Another prototype-

Manufactured ZipSeam 1.0

ZipSeam 2.0 Drawing

ZipSeam 2.0 Prototype

story:
I am trying to raise money to stock geeky/fandom leggings in time for convention season starting in February. I already have a bunch of designs and I am hoping to have two or three actually in-stock by the time con season starts.

I have already invested my own money in a full run of one of my Hunger Games designs, that are already on sale at my friends etsy.

But our North Pacific convention season is starting in Feb this year and I don't have enough of my own money to get enough stock in time or the time to build to it slowly.

All the money I make up to my goal will go to buying a run of my Supernatural design in white on black, a preview of which is pictured in the campaign photo.

Anything I make over that will go towards buying runs in some of my other designs.... I want you to vote on which one I buy next! Email me your votes at damec_fate@hotmail.com!

  Attack on Titan Racing Stripe with either all three crests or just the survey corps. crest

  Sailor Senshi Inspired Inner Senshi with Symbols near the bottom of the legs or Outer Senshi

If you aren't interested in any of the designs I'm planning to buy in the next few months and want to get your money's worth, don't worry! You can see sample of a few more of my designs here and use your perk when they are in-stock.

I will eventually invest in more sizing both larger and smaller, but I want to prioritize a diverse selection first.

Please message me directly to arrange your prize, damec_fate@hotmail.com

The leggings will be handmade in Canada with materials made in Canada and all designs by me. Made from ultra-stretch PolySpandex blend fabric that won’t lose shape even after multiple wearings. Fabric contains 88% polyester and 12% spandex.

Thank you so much for your contribution! I really appreciate your support.

story:
WELCOME TO CALEE'S PLUS SIZE SHOES FOR WOMEN.  

SHOES THAT WILL INSPIRE A PASSION FOR FASHION.

 

 

 

 

THE VISION

It's often said, "Necessity is the Mother of invention." You see I wear a perfect size 12 shoe.  I would find myself running from where the sun rises to where it sets to find a shoe and still arrive home empty handed. This was very frustrating to me - the difficulty of trying to find fashionable and affordable shoes in my size.  During a telephone conversation with a good friend, I shared my frustration and she in turn saw my vision and commented,  "If you opened your own store, your search would be over."

Armed with my experience, which encompasses more than 10 years in retail, sales, and marketing, I began to do my homework.  My expertise in fashion and merchandising assisted me in my journey to find as many plus size shoe suppliers as humanly possible.  In this time, I've consulted with many industry advisors, crunched numbers, met with a retail attorney, and attended countless conferences and seminars.  These steps were essential to establishing a business plan that is solid, and today I feel more than ready to make this company a reality - a raging success

 

 

 

 

 

THE GOAL

Calee's goal is to be the shoe shopping destination of choice for style-conscious women who appreciate value and wear a larger size shoe.

Imagine a store where everyone knows your name. A store where you could have the services of your very own personal shopper.

A store where you could have as little or as much attention as you'd like.  Imagine a store that you could feel was exclusively yours!

100% of funds raised will be allocated towards the Opening of Calee's Shoes.

  • Store construction and design - Interior Design and decorating cost, fixtures, displays, showcases, shelves/racks etc.
  • Fees and Permits - Licenses, permits and merchant account fees (for accepting and processing credit cards)
  • Promotion Expenses - Store signage, advertising and promotion for launch, visuals.
  • Operating Expenses - Opening inventory and bags with company logo.
  • Administrative Cost - Office supplies, cleaning supplies, miscellanous
  • Equipment - Point of Sale systems (Credit Card and check processing machines. Bar code reader, cash drawer, POS software ect.) Security Cameras.

 

MAKING A DIFFERENCE

The majority of shoe stores today are overwhelmingly focused on women who wear sizes 6 through 10. While this focus is relevant for the needs of most buyers, it tends to overlook and downplay the important needs of buyers whose sizes extend beyond the so-called norm. So, what about us? 

Today, the ability for the woman who wears a size 11, 12 or 13 shoe to walk into a shoe store and request her size is nearly impossible. Although the shoe industry has expanded rapidly in the past several years, it has failed to realize and catch up with the fact that people are getting taller and heavier, and their feet are keeping pace - as they have for generations. 

According to the Professional Shoe Fitting Manual, in the 1960s, the average American adult female shoe was a 5.5 or 6; in the '80s it had reached 8 or 8.5.  Today 37% of women in our society wear a size 9 shoe or above.

United We Can Make A Difference

No more shopping on-line and hoping the shoe will fit.  Calee's will deliver an incredible buying experience with an unmatched extensive selection of shoes for women who wear sizes 9 through 13.  My mission is to redefine the shoe shopping experience for we women who leave a larger footprint - to provide an unmatched selection of shoes that will create more opportunities to look and feel absolutely gorgeous!

Together we can make change!  IT'S ABOUT TIME.

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Shoe Love Is True Love. 

If you love shoes as much as I do, help me make some noise about our campaign.

Talk about it, Tweet about it, share it with your friends and family.

**Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools as well**

story:
About Myself:

My name Is Spencer, i'm a Highschool student looking to make a dream come true. Legacy Supply Co, that's my clothing lines name. I wanted to make a clothing brand for several years when I first went into Highschool, I now finally made a move on it after time to think and come up with ideas. I came up with Legacy to use because it sounded like a good Sportswear/Streetwear clothing name. I did it because I was sick of seeing clothing lines from places like PacSun and Tillys always having the same look and designs. Another reason I did it was because I hated paying 35 40 dollars just for a hat and 65$ for a sweatshirt. Now I've came here to ask for your help to help me achieve my dream in making a clothing line.


What We Need & What You Get

What we need is $1,000 USD. The money is going to the funding of supplies as in the sweatshirts, hats and other things needed to start an inventory for people to start buying things and for the website to make it a user friendly and a good website for people to browse. The perks for you guys are amazing! The 5$ one is just a thank you written on our page with your name on it. The 10$ one is a VIP thank you which you are above all the 5$ donors on that page. Getting to the good stuff with a 25$ Donation you get a Legacy embroidered snapback, For 40$ you get a Legacy logoed Sweatshirt and for 60$ Get the both of them !.

If the funding is not completed it will still go to the things I have said it will go to, and the people that did help fund will still receive their things that they donated to get.  

    The Impact

    This means a lot to me to be able to start my own clothing line. I want to later down the road either open my own store with my clothing or get it to be sold in stores.

    It will impact the clothing industry because teens/young adults who want to have that streetwear/sportswear look in their life can with the not as expensive clothing!

      Risks & Challenges

      Some risks and obstacles we might run into are getting the clothing in on time from being shipped from the warehouses or getting them shipped to you on time. But I will overcome those so they don't happen by always staying on task and by working around the clock to get those things in and rushed to you. 

        Other Ways You Can Help

        For the people that can't contribute with money that's all fine with me! 

        Some ways you can help is get the word out about my Campaign and find people that would be interested in my clothing.

        Use the indiegogo campaign share tools! and share away!
story_txt:
About Myself:
My name Is Spencer, i'm a Highschool student looking to make a dream come true. Legacy Supply Co, that's my clothing lines name. I wanted to make a clothing brand for several years when I first went into Highschool, I now finally made a move on it after time to think and come up with ideas. I came up with Legacy to use because it sounded like a good Sportswear/Streetwear clothing name. I did it because I was sick of seeing clothing lines from places like PacSun and Tillys always having the same look and designs. Another reason I did it was because I hated paying 35 40 dollars just for a hat and 65$ for a sweatshirt. Now I've came here to ask for your help to help me achieve my dream in making a clothing line.    What We Need & What You Get What we need is $1,000 USD. The money is going to the funding of supplies as in the sweatshirts, hats and other things needed to start an inventory for people to start buying things and for the website to make it a user friendly and a good website for people to browse. The perks for you guys are amazing! The 5$ one is just a thank you written on our page with your name on it. The 10$ one is a VIP thank you which you are above all the 5$ donors on that page. Getting to the good stuff with a 25$ Donation you get a Legacy embroidered snapback, For 40$ you get a Legacy logoed Sweatshirt and for 60$ Get the both of them !.
If the funding is not completed it will still go to the things I have said it will go to, and the people that did help fund will still receive their things that they donated to get.  

  The Impact This means a lot to me to be able to start my own clothing line. I want to later down the road either open my own store with my clothing or get it to be sold in stores.
It will impact the clothing industry because teens/young adults who want to have that streetwear/sportswear look in their life can with the not as expensive clothing!

  Risks & Challenges Some risks and obstacles we might run into are getting the clothing in on time from being shipped from the warehouses or getting them shipped to you on time. But I will overcome those so they don't happen by always staying on task and by working around the clock to get those things in and rushed to you. 

  Other Ways You Can Help For the people that can't contribute with money that's all fine with me! 
Some ways you can help is get the word out about my Campaign and find people that would be interested in my clothing.
Use the indiegogo campaign share tools! and share away!

story:
My name is Karen and I am from Rockland County, New York.  I am a mother of 3 boys.  I am currently a homemaker.  I have always been creative and have worked and applied my creative energy into doing many things since being out of the corporate world.  

After much consideration and my passion to build and market my own brand, KLARE NEW YORK was born.  KLARE stands for the first initial of everyone in my family in exact order.  One of my favorite things to do is create and seeing creations out of art.  I am working towards creating my line of nail polish, KLARE POLISH.  I love doing my nails and I am obsessed with the art created on them with nail polish.  The nail industry is booming and this is a great opportunity to get my brand out there.  The nail polish line that I would be creating is made of 5-free formulas, dibutyl phthalate (DBP), toluene, and formaldehyde, formaldehyde resin and camphor.  This is especially safer for kids and moms-to-be to use.  Of course I will have my very own custom colors created as well.   New shades will be introduced each season to keep the line fresh and current with the day’s most popular trends.  And most importantly everything will be made in the USA.  With my background in business and expertise in marketing I am sure this will hit the ground running.

Your pledge will help obtain the level of success that would not be possible without your support.  I am also prepared to generously compensate our sponsors with a gift bag of our line once produced.
In order to be able to start the process for the nail polish line, I will need a total of $2400. This will go towards the licensing/legal, production, packaging and marketing.  I've already invested in the creation of the logo and the domain page. 

If you can't help financially, thats ok.  You can help by sharing this and use #klarenewyork.  :)

story:
Two remarkable discoveries of quantum physics involve the phenomena of entanglement and non-local communication.  Entanglement is the observation that a quantum particle, such as a photon, can be split into two particles that share the same quantum state.  Thus quantities such as momentum are conserved between them, even if the particles are far apart.  Although Albert Einstein was one of the founders of quantum theory, he was one of its harshest critics and considered it to be, if not wrong, then incomplete.  To that end he, with two colleges, published a thought experiment in which he illustrated what is known as the EPR Paradox, which anticipated the complexities of quantum entanglement by postulating that under that circumstance, the entangled particles would have to communicate with each other instantaneously (in other words, much faster than light, or superluminally), which was forbidden by the theory of relativity.  Einstein called this “spooky action at a distance.”

The concept of non-local communication, or communication between particles not in physical contact or proximity, has been demonstrated by the violation of Bell’s inequality, which showed that particles do not have defined properties, such as momentum, until they are measured.  Thus the measurement of a property of one entangled particle in one side of the universe somehow affects the same property in the other entangled particle on the other side of the universe.  Most scientists dismiss this as mere correlation, since observers on the two sides cannot compare each other’s results other than by classical means at a finite speed.  Thus it is not believed that any actual communication is transmitted instantly by entanglement, since any transfer of information involves the transfer of energy, which must obey relativistic physics and travel subliminally. 

In 1998, however, an unpublished doctoral thesis by the Austrian Birgit Dopfer indicated that instant communication over a distance may be possible.  In an experiment, Dopfer generated entangled photons.  One set passed through a double slit to create the familiar interference pattern.  The other set was measured to determine which slit the first set passed through.  Whether one set was measured or not appeared to affect whether the other set exhibited an interference pattern or not, mimicking, over distance, the well-known phenomenon of photon wave/particle duality first observed by Thomas Young in the 19th century.  If Dopfer’s experiment can be confirmed, it demonstrates a new form of entanglement that goes beyond mere correlation and implies that instant, non-local energy-less communication is possible.

So if superluminal communication is possible, can that be the basis for retrocausal signaling, or actually transmitting information back in time?      Again, most scientists state that this is not possible.  Experiments, however, have demonstrated that at the quantum level, the arrow of time appears to travel in both directions.  This has been shown by so-called “quantum eraser” experiments, in which one entangled object appears to communicate with its twin backward in time so that the experimenter has the luxury of actually erasing a past event (see Kim, Yoon-Ho; R. Yu, S.P. Kulik, Y.H. Shih and Marlan Scully (2000). "A Delayed Choice Quantum Eraser". Physical Review Letters 84: 1–5).

Building on these ideas, a small number of respected scientists are attempting to test retrocausality.  One scientist at the University of Connecticut, working from different principles, is even trying to build a time machine to transport not just information but actual energy or matter back in time.  All agree that some form of time travel will be possible within a decade.  The race is on. 

It is my intention to conduct a series of experiments to test retrocausal transmission of information based on Dopfer’s discovery.  To accomplish this I will need to invest in a high-quality optics bench lab, which includes lasers, special crystals, lenses and detectors, as well as computer hardware and custom programming.  If this project is successful, donors will have a part in perhaps the greatest discovery in the history of science.

story:
WHY CURVY MAGAZINE?

It's over 155 Million women in the US and 62% of those women are a size 12 or above – that’s about 96 million plus size women. Yes 96 million women that does NOT have any publication in print targeting their wants or needs. The largest female consumer base have no voice in media. The time is NOW for Curvy Magazine. And the numbers have proven because in less than a year Curvy Magazine has grown to be the 2nd largest online plus size publication in the United States. Now we ask for your help to allow us to reach the majority of today's female consumers, the plus size woman!

About CURVY MAGAZINE

Curvy is a women focused publication bridging the gap between myth and reality regarding beauty and body image. Though Curvy's multiple media channels, our content covers the latest and best of trends in Fashion, Entertainment, Beauty, Health, positive body image, and lifestyle. 

Curvy Magazine’s includes the following media channels:

•  CurvyMagazine.com is a bold website to provide quality content in the form of exclusive interviews, broadband video, articles, pictures, interactive giveaways, and rich niche geared content to enhance the emotional connection and social interaction among the ever-expanding base of the Curvy Community.
 
• Social Media: Curvy is apart of the largest online network for curvy women and engages with thousands of individuals every day through social media channels. Follow @CURVY and LIKE CURVY on FB. 
 
• Digital Publication: Seasonal style guides directly engaging readers with retailers and designers. The digital publication has genereated a 50,000+ subscriber base.
 
•  Print Publication: Launching spring 2013 with a glossy pictorial & engaging editorial content offered quarterly nationwide.
 
• Events: Curvy is involved in a variety of events and have produced several sold out fashion events. CURVY is also every where covering events like Fashion Weeks, Award Shows, Sundance Film Festival, Celebrity Bashes, and MORE.
 

Industry Support

After only a year and a half in digital publication Curvy has partnered with and been supported by serveral noteworthy brands such as Macy's, Covergirl, QVC, Forever 21, and many more. 
 
 

Your Support

Your donation will fund the first year of priting, staffing (writers & photographers), dedicated server fees for our website, and event oppuntities to connect with our readership.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to pledge an amount, your support is not lost.  Help spread the word about Curvy Magazine's campaign.  Tell your friends and family.  Share on Facebook, Twitter, etc.  Tweet and message your favorite brands.

story:
I am looking at the detrimental environmental and health effects of the Tar Sands development on farmers and First Nations in Alberta.

 

During the summer of 2010, I went to Fort McMurray to document the environmental damage that the Tar Sands development is bringing to the Athabasca River but more importantly, how the bitumen mining and SAGD/fracturing operations ( extraction by use of steam and chemicals) is impacting the health of the farmers in the Fort Saskatchewan area and the Cree Nations in the Peace River country.

I have produced a short eight minute multimedia piece, combining stills and audio and would use the money to complete the project by looking at the expansion of the pipeline infrastructure in British Columbia into First Nations territory; the First Nations have not been consulted and do not want the pipelines running through their land.  The infrastructure is regularly sabotaged in protest and the legal situation is complicated by the lack of a peace treaty covering land ownership with the Canadian Federal Government.  

I would also like to spend more time with the Loubicon Cree and farmers in the Peace River country as they battle the corporations to enforce emission controls.  

I would like to show there are alternatives to the Tar Sands, for example, Photovoltaic energy is a growing industry around Grand Prairie. 

The money raised will go towards per diems expenses in Canada, making a longer DVD that will be entered to documentary festivals such as The Sheffield Documentary Festival, a book through Blurb which will be marketed on-line and at photography festivals, such as Perpignan and Arles and linking with an environmental campaigner who is already working in the Tar Sands.

In return, the sponsor will receive a signed print of their choice and a DVD of the final project. I am also looking to start a blog relating my experiences.

story:
You missed our campaign? You'll find us here!

 

 

A new way of consuming is emerging. We want less, but better.

Yet, there’s never been as many consumer choices as today, many of them with poor quality. That’s also true for espadrilles.

I am from the south of France where traditional craft of espadrilles is a cultural heritage. Artisans produce the most beautiful and long-lasting shoes. Despite their origin, only 1% of the world’s espadrilles are handmade there.

Since we launched Atelier Aliénor in 2017, we’ve had one goal in mind : promote this heritage by offering our customers their dreamy durable espadrille.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

     

 

 

EXCLUSIVE OFFER

Only 30 lucky mademoiselles will be able to custom their own pairs! Select your favorite style - lace-up sandal, slide, crossover sandal - and your favorite color.

 

You can also choose your favorite ribbons: whether you like the minimalist linen ribbon or whether you prefer the more sophisticated colored one.

 

We are collaborating with the amazing lifestyle brand Orez, based in NYC. Orez is a female-founded company that share our values of conscious living. They create beautiful & reusable goods for minimizing waste.

For every pair you buy, you'll get a large linen bag to carry your espadrilles and/or your everyday things. They are the best alternative to plastic bags.

Thoughtfully made in New York.

 

At Atelier Aliénor, we love to add a little bit of poetry, a touch of romance and a lot of dream into everything we do. That's why we are honored to collaborate with the artist Augusto BM from Brazil. He draws lines inspired by ancient times that link human and nature.

For every pair you'll buy, we are happy to offer you Flora, our favorite drawing from Augusto.

 

 

 

When I decided to launch Atelier Aliénor back in 2016, I had a clear vision of what I wanted: a beautiful product, well made, honest and with a story. So I left Paris (where I was living at that time) and drove to the Basque Country in the southwest of France, the cradle of espadrilles. That's where I found one of the last family-owned workshops.

Our shoe-making process is as an art involving traditional know-how and expertise.

Each of our pair takes about 45 minutes to be crafted compared to less than 5 minutes with an industrial production. It is a slower process but it produce a more durable, higher quality espadrilles you'll be able to wear for years.

 

 

 

 

Melissa D.

"These espadrilles are the summer shoe of my dreams! The quality is excellent, the fit is spot on and the color is a chic neutral. I wear them with everything - dresses, shorts, jeans. Absolutely beautiful."

Ainsley A.

"Absolutely beautiful shoes, can’t wait to purchase some more styles and colours!"

Giselle N.R

"So perfect in every way! These shoes are incredibly comfortable and well made! They have become my new go-to shoes for any outfit especially if I know I will be walking a lot. I've been wearing these daily and I can tell these are going to last me for years because the quality is amazing."

 

 

 

 

Choose your usual size. In between sizes, please size up.

All of our shoes will and should have a firm fit and feel snug as a sock at first (as long as they are not uncomfortable and pressing too hard). The leather of the mules and lace-up sandals will give and perfectly conforms to your feet within a few wears. We recommend you try them on inside and walk around for a bit.
Since we'll have a limited stock of the 2020 collection for exchange, we encourage you to measure your feet at home to be 100% sure!

HOW TO FIND YOUR SIZE:

Here is what you'll need:
- a sheet of paper

- a ruler

- a pencil or masking tape

1. Barefoot, stand on the sheet of paper with your heel against a straight wall. Do this in the evening, or the afternoon at least, once you’ve been on your feet for a while.
2. Mark the end of your foot with a pencil or by placing a piece of masking tape on the floor parallel to the wall.
3. Stand back up straight and check again. Adjust the tape if necessary.
4. Measure the length of your foot from the heel to your longest toe. Compare this measurement with the lengths (cm) in the size chart below.

 

 

 

All of our espadrilles are designed to last, that's why we chose only high quality materials. The exquisite leather we use is stain resistant and water resistant so no need to waterproof them or use any products on them. You can use our crepe brush from time to time to remove stains or dust. Available for $15 only!

 

We are building our foundations to create beautiful espadrilles with you and for you.

Help us spread the word by sharing this campaign across your social networks via Facebook, Instagram, Linkedin and Twitter. You're making a big difference for a female run company and we (and the universe) love you for that. Simply use the Indiegogo share's tool at the very top of this page, next to my profile.

 

To my sunshines.
